{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Sasha Velour | image = Sasha Velour (cropped).jpg | caption = Sasha Velour at RuPaul's DragCon [[New York City|New York]] 2017 | birth_name = Alexander Hedges Steinberg{{cite web |title=Mother: Sasha Velour |url=https://nightout.com/events/mother-sasha-velour/tickets |website=Night Out |accessdate=June 24, 2017}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|6|25}} | birth_place = [[Berkeley, California]], U.S. | residence = [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City|New York]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | education = [[Vassar College]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])}}
[[Center for Cartoon Studies]] {{small|([[Master of Fine Arts|MFA]])}} | occupation = [[Drag queen]], artist | years_active = 2009–present | known_for = [[RuPaul's Drag Race (season 9)|''RuPaul's Drag Race'' (season 9)]] winner | predecessor = [[Bob the Drag Queen]] | successor = [[Aquaria (drag queen)|Aquaria]] | website = {{URL|sashavelour.com}} }} '''Alexander "Sasha" Hedges Steinberg''' (born June 25, 1987), also known by the [[Drag (clothing)|drag]] name '''Sasha Velour''', is an American [[drag queen]], artist and creative director based in Brooklyn, New York.{{Cite web|url=http://sashavelour.com/about-1/|title=about|website=Sasha Velour|access-date=June 24, 2017}} Velour is best known for winning the [[RuPaul's Drag Race (season 9)|ninth season]] of ''[[RuPaul's Drag Race]],'' and for producing the monthly drag show Nightgowns, hosted at [[National Sawdust]] in [[Williamsburg, Brooklyn]]. == Early life and education == Steinberg was born in [[Berkeley, California]], the only child of [[Mark D. Steinberg|Mark Steinberg]] and Jane Hedges. She is of Russian Jewish descent on her father's side. She was raised in Connecticut until the age of 9 when the family moved to Urbana, Illinois, where her father is a Russian historian at the [[University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign|University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign]]. Her mother served as the Managing Editor of the ''[[Slavic Review]]''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.renner-wikoffchapel.com/fh/obituaries/obituary.cfm?o_id=3200453&fh_id=10562|title=Obituary for Jane Hedges at Renner-Wikoff Chapel and Crematory|publisher=renner-wikoffchapel.com|access-date=June 24, 2017}} The family later relocated to [[New Haven, Connecticut]], when her father began teaching Russian history at [[Yale University]].{{Cite web|url=https://history.illinois.edu/directory/profile/steinb|title=Mark D Steinberg {{!}} History at Illinois|website=history.illinois.edu|language=en|access-date=2018-09-23}} Steinberg graduated from [[University Laboratory High School (Urbana, Illinois)|University Laboratory High School]] in [[Champaign–Urbana metropolitan area|Champaign-Urbana]] in 2004.{{Cite news|last=Merli|first=Melissa|date=June 8, 2015|title=Studio Visit: Sasha Steinberg and John Jacob Lee|url=http://www.news-gazette.com/arts-entertainment/local/2015-06-08/studio-visit-sasha-steinberg-and-john-jacob-lee.html|work=News-Gazette|location=Champaign, IL|access-date=June 24, 2017|language=en}} After high school, she spent time as a part-time security guard at the [[Hermitage Museum|Russian State Hermitage Museum]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.grizzlykiki.com/podcast/podcast/sasha-velour|title=Sasha Velour|work=Grizzly Kiki|access-date=June 24, 2017|language=en-US}} in [[Saint Petersburg|St. Petersburg]], Russia, and interned at the [[Staatsoper Berlin|Staatsoper]] (State Opera){{Cite news|url=http://forward.com/culture/art/318495/sasha-velours-talmud-of-drag/|title=Inside Sasha Velour's Talmud of Drag|work=The Forward|access-date=June 24, 2017}} in [[Berlin]], Germany. Steinberg obtained a BA in Modern Literature from [[Vassar College]] in 2009. In 2010, she was a [[Fulbright Program|Fulbright Scholar]] in Moscow and completed a project that aimed to understand the role of different art forms in contemporary Russian society.{{Cite web|url=http://fulbright.ru/en/steinbergAMC|title=The Fulbright Program in Russia {{!}} "Lost in Translation: The Theory and Practice of Experimental Translation"|website=fulbright.ru|access-date=June 24, 2017}} She received an MFA in Cartooning in 2013 from the [[Center for Cartoon Studies]] in [[White River Junction, Vermont|White River Junction]], Vermont.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cartoonstudies.org/tag/sasha-velour/|title=Congratulations to RuPaul's Drag Race Winner Sasha Velour '13!|work=The Center for Cartoon Studies|access-date=July 17, 2017}} Prior to pursuing drag as a full-time career, Steinberg worked as a freelance graphic designer and illustrator.{{Citation|last=Logo|title='The Reigning Queen' Out Of The Closet w/ Sasha Velour Ep. 1 {{!}} Logo|date=April 24, 2018|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HWSCJ38r2H4|accessdate=May 7, 2018}} == Career == [[File:Rupaul Dragcon 2018-166 (42030784862).jpg|thumb|Sasha Velour in RuPaul's DragCon LA 2018.]] Steinberg's drag career as Sasha Velour started in Vermont while at school.{{Cite web|url=https://thotyssey.tumblr.com/post/151478750581/on-point-with-sasha-velour|title=On Point With: Sasha Velour|website=Thotyssey!|access-date=June 24, 2017}} Known for being an out of the box artist, Steinberg incorporates that eccentricity into Velour's drag persona. Steinberg starred in the music video C.L.A.T. along with fellow New York City drag queens [[Peppermint (drag queen)|Peppermint]], [[Aja (drag queen)|Aja]] and Alexis Michelle, who also appeared on the ninth season of ''RuPaul's Drag Race''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7767972/rupauls-drag-race-new-york-city-queens-clat|title='RuPaul's Drag Race' Season 9 Queens From NYC Team Up for 'C.L.A.T.' Video: Exclusive|work=Billboard|access-date=June 24, 2017}} Velour's makeup and look transformations have been featured in publications such as ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'',{{Cite web|url=http://www.vogue.com/article/sasha-velour-rupaul-drag-race-karl-lagerfeld-celebrity-style/amp|title=Sasha Velour From RuPaul's Drag Race Season 9 on Her Style Icons and Winning the Title|website=Vogue|access-date=June 29, 2017}} ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]'',{{Cite news|url=http://www.cosmopolitan.com/style-beauty/beauty/a10017266/sasha-velour-makeup-transformation/|title=You Have to See Sasha Velour's Stunning Makeup Transformation|date=June 13, 2017|work=Cosmopolitan|access-date=June 24, 2017|language=en}} ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'',{{Cite news|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/06/sasha-velour-rupauls-drag-race-winner|title=RuPaul's Drag Race Winner Sasha Velour on That Shocking Finale and the Britney Spears Stunt You Didn't See|last=Desta|first=Yohana|work=HWD|access-date=July 3, 2017|language=en}} and ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/lifestyle/7834060/rock-the-look-rupauls-drag-race-sasha-velour|title=Rock the Look: 'RuPaul's Drag Race' Finalist Sasha Velour is a Master at Recreating This Iconic Look|work=Billboard|access-date=June 24, 2017}} Steinberg has further created, produced, and organized different photoshoots, collages, and drawings that discuss art and drag.{{Cite web|url=http://sashavelour.com/work|title=Home|website=Sasha Velour|access-date=June 24, 2017}} === Comics and design === Steinberg's comics and illustrations have appeared in The Nib, InkBRICK,{{Cite news|url=http://inkbrick.com/post/141516785392/from-what-now-by-sasha-steinberg-in-ink-brick|title=INK BRICK – From "What Now" by Sasha Steinberg in INK BRICK...|last=BRICK|first=INK|work=INK BRICK|access-date=June 24, 2017|language=en}} Comics Workbook Magazine,{{Cite web|url=https://www.copaceticcomics.com/comics/comics-workbook-magazine-2|title=Comics Workbook Magazine #2 by Frank Santoro, Andrew White, Zach Mason, Warren Craghead III, Lala Albert, Whit Taylor, Jen Rickert, Derek Badman, Evie Cahir|publisher=copaceticcomics.com|access-date=June 24, 2017}} QU33R,{{Cite web|url=http://begallerynyc.tumblr.com/pastexhibitions|title=Past Exhibitions|website=begallerynyc.tumblr.com|access-date=June 24, 2017}} Cicada Magazine{{Cite web|url=http://www.cicadamag.com/thisissue/artist-allies-sasha-velour|title=Artist Allies: Sasha Velour|publisher=cicadamag.com|access-date=June 24, 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160601142947/http://www.cicadamag.com/thisissue/artist-allies-sasha-velour|archivedate=June 1, 2016|df=mdy-all}} and others, under the names Sasha Velour and Sasha Steinberg. Steinberg also created a series of comics entitled "Stonewall", which told the story of the [[Stonewall riots]] from multiple viewpoints. The series was called "a smart, beautiful and artful take on a significant and difficult historical event" by Highlow Comics.{{Cite web|url=https://highlowcomics.blogspot.nl/2013/11/thirty-days-of-ccs-3-sasha-steinberg.html|title=Thirty Days of CCS #3: Sasha Steinberg|website=highlowcomics.blogspot.nl|access-date=June 24, 2017}} A solo gallery show of Steinberg's illustration work, "Nightrooms", was held at the Black Box Gallery in [[Brooklyn]] in March 2016 and Steinberg's cut paper work was part of the group show "Coney Island Babies, Visual Artists from the Brooklyn Drag Scene" at the Bureau of General Services Queer Division that opened in [[Manhattan]] in November 2012.{{Cite web|url=http://bgsqd.com/strange-loop-gallery-hosts-the-bureau-of-general-services-queer-division-pop-up-shop/|title=Strange Loop Gallery Hosts The Bureau of General Services—Queer Division Pop-Up Shop : BGSQD {{!}} The Bureau of General Services – Queer Division|website=bgsqd.com|access-date=May 7, 2018}} In March 2017, Steinberg designed a long sleeve T-shirt for "Contemporary Drag", a limited-edition fashion line for the [[New Art Dealers Alliance]]'s (NADA) in collaboration with Print All Over Me.{{Cite news|url=http://ma.de/nada-x-poam-contemporary-drag-collection/|title=NADA x PAOM: Contemporary Drag collection {{!}} MADE|date=February 23, 2017|work=MADE|access-date=June 24, 2017|language=en-US}} Steinberg selected 40 LGBTQIA+ models to walk for [[Opening Ceremony (brand)|Opening Ceremony]] in the 2018 [[New York Fashion Week]].{{Cite web|url=https://cms.intomore.com/was-this-new-york-fashion-week-the-queerest-season-ever/|title=INTO: A Digital Magazine For The Modern Queer World|website=cms.intomore.com|language=en|access-date=2018-09-17}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/comprehensive-guide-most-show-stopping-220144705.html|title=A Comprehensive Guide to the Most Show-Stopping Moments of New York Fashion Week|access-date=2018-09-17|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://ulmhawkeyeonline.com/23701/freestyle/top-3-nyfw-collections/|title=Top 3 NYFW collections|last=Dennis|first=Ethan|work=The Hawkeye|access-date=2018-09-17|language=en-US}} Steinberg attended [[Rihanna]]'s fourth annual Diamond Ball in September 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://www.wmagazine.com/gallery/rihanna-fourth-annual-diamond-ball|title=Rihanna Hosted a Wild Black-Tie Ball for a Good Cause|last=McCarthy|first=Lauren|work=W Magazine|access-date=2018-09-17|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/diamond-ball-2018-issa-rae-normani-more-rihannas-influence-1143443|title=Issa Rae, Normani and More Stars Talk Rihanna's Influence at Diamond Ball|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-09-17|language=en}} === ''Velour, The Drag Magazine'' === Steinberg founded ''Velour, The Drag Magazine'' (originally named ''Vym''), a bi-yearly publication about drag, alongside partner Johnny in the summer of 2014.{{cite news|url=http://www.news-gazette.com/arts-entertainment/local/2017-06-27/urbana-native-uni-alum-wins-season-9-rupauls-drag-race.html|title=Urbana native, Uni alum wins Season 9 of 'RuPaul's Drag Race'|last=Merli|first=Melissa|date=June 27, 2017|work=News-Gazette|access-date=October 7, 2017|location=Champaign, IL}} Steinberg serves as the magazine's artistic director. The first issue ("What is Drag?") was released June 2015 and the second issue ("Realness") was released in October 2016.{{Cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/velour-issue-two-realness_us_580a70cce4b02444efa366a8|title=This Beautiful Drag Magazine Is Providing A Comprehensive Guide To 'Realness'|last=Nichols|first=James Michael|date=October 22, 2016|work=HuffPost|access-date=June 24, 2017|language=en-US}} The magazine includes interviews as well as varied art forms such as photography, poetry, and illustration that address the power, beauty, and purpose of drag.{{Cite web|url=http://thedragmagazine.com/about-2/|title=About|website=VELOUR {{!}} The Drag Magazine|access-date=June 24, 2017}} === Nightgowns === Since August 2015, Velour has produced 'Nightgowns', a monthly drag show in Brooklyn. The events have been regularly hosted at Bizarre Bushwick and National Sawdust. The shows have been celebrated as "beautiful and funny and politically charged" by ''The New York Times''.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/24/arts/gay-pride-new-york-all-drag-weekend.html|title=It's Gay Pride Weekend: Dress the Part|last=Piepenburg|first=Erik|date=June 23, 2016|work=The New York Times|access-date=June 24, 2017|issn=0362-4331}} === ''RuPaul's Drag Race'' === Velour tried out for [[RuPaul's Drag Race|''RuPaul's Drag Race'']]'s eighth season, but was not selected for the lineup.{{cite news|last1=Rudolph|first1=Christopher|title=Sasha Velour on Being Picked For 'Drag Race': "I Was Shocked I Got On"|url=http://www.newnownext.com/sasha-velour-drag-race-season-9-audition/06/2017/?xrs=synd_facebook_logo|accessdate=June 30, 2017|publisher=NewNowNext|date=June 29, 2017}} In March 2017, she was announced as one of 14 contestants on the ninth season of the show. In June 2017, Sasha Velour was crowned the winner of the season, and was the show's previous reigning winner (succeeded by [[Aquaria (drag queen)|Aquaria]] as of June 2018).{{Cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2017/06/25/534313492/rupauls-drag-race-winner-sasha-velour-cut-from-a-different-fabric|title='RuPaul's Drag Race' Winner Sasha Velour Cut From A Different Fabric|publisher=NPR|access-date=June 25, 2017}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.vogue.com/article/sasha-velour-rupaul-drag-race-karl-lagerfeld-celebrity-style|title=Sasha Velour From RuPaul's Drag Race on Her Style Icons and How to Be a Queen|work=Vogue|access-date=June 29, 2017|language=en}} Allison Shoemaker of ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' named Velour's lipsync to [[Whitney Houston]]'s "[[So Emotional]]" in the season finale the best TV performance of 2017.{{Cite news|url=https://www.avclub.com/looking-for-the-performance-of-the-year-watch-2-minute-1821318303/amp?__twitter_impression=true|title=Looking for the performance of the year? Watch 2 minutes of RuPaul's Drag Race|author=Shoemaker, Allison|work=[[The A.V. Club]]|publisher=Onion, Inc.|date=December 26, 2017|accessdate=December 26, 2017}} == Personal life == Steinberg currently{{when|date=September 2018}} resides in Brooklyn, New York, with partner John Jacob Lee (known as Johnny Velour) and their pet [[Italian Greyhound|Italian greyhound]], Vanya.{{Cite news|url=http://bedfordandbowery.com/2015/12/sasha-velour-talks-vym-a-magazine-spotlighting-the-revolutionary-art-of-drag/|title=Sasha Velour Talks Vym, a Magazine Spotlighting the 'Revolutionary' Art of Drag|work=Bedford + Bowery|access-date=July 3, 2017|language=en-US}} Steinberg is [[genderqueer]] and does not have any preferred pronouns when not in drag. Her drag persona, Sasha Velour, is referred to as 'she'.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/sasha_velour/status/830305619886366720|title=Thank so much for asking @glassarmy! For my Velour self—always she/her (out of drag its even less binary lol...any will do) #genderqueer|last=Velour|first=Sasha|date=February 10, 2017|website=@sasha_velour|access-date=March 19, 2018}}{{Primary source inline|date=April 2018}}{{Primary source inline|date=May 2018}} Steinberg has a shaved head. As Sasha, she often performs in drag bald as a tribute to her mother, Jane Hedges, who died of cancer in 2015 and had lost her hair during treatment for the disease. ==See also== * [[LGBT culture in New York City]] == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Commons category|Sasha Velour}} * {{Official website|http://sashavelour.com/}} {{RuPaul's Drag Race}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Velour, Sasha}} [[Category:1987 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American people of Russian descent]] [[Category:American drag queens]] [[Category:LGBT entertainers from the United States]] [[Category:New York City nightlife]] [[Category:Reality show winners]] [[Category:RuPaul's Drag Race winners|Sasha Velour]] [[Category:Vassar College alumni]] [[Category:Fulbright Scholars]] [[Category:LGBT people from Connecticut]] [[Category:LGBT people from Illinois]] [[Category:Genderqueer people]] [[Category:People with non-binary gender identities]]

{{Infobox Jewish leader | honorific-prefix =Rabbi | name =Sekl Loeb Wormser | honorific-suffix = | title =Ba'al Shem of Michelstadt | image =LöbWormser Grab 4.jpg | caption =''[[Kvitlach]]'' piled at the grave of the Ba'al Shem of Michelstadt | synagogue = | synagogueposition= | yeshiva = | yeshivaposition = | organisation = | organisationposition= | began = | ended = | rabbi = | birth_name = | birth_date =1768 | birth_place =[[Michelstadt]] | death_date =1846 | death_place = | yahrtzeit =3 [[Tishrei]] ([[Fast of Gedalia]]){{cite encyclopedia|last=Illoway|first=Dr. Henry|author-link=|editor-first=Julius|editor-last=Eisenstein|editor-link=Julius Eisenstein|encyclopedia=Ozar Yisrael|title=בעל שם, זעקיל ליב ווארמסער|url=http://hebrewbooks.org/pdfpager.aspx?req=2592&st=&pgnum=145|access-date=Mar 26, 2015|language=Hebrew|year=1909|volume=III|location=New York|oclc=233058656|pages=138–139}} | buried =Michelstadt | residence = | parents = | spouse = | children = }} '''Sekl Loeb Wormser''' (1768–1846){{Cite Jewish Encyclopedia|title=BA'AL SHEM|url=http://jewishencyclopedia.com/articles/2249-ba-al-shem|accessdate=March 5, 2015}} was a [[rabbi]], [[talmudist]], [[kabbalist]], and [[Baal Shem]] (worker of miracles through the [[Name of God in Judaism|Name of God]]). He was born in [[Michelstadt]]. He received his talmudic education in [[Frankfurt]], in the [[yeshiva]] of Rabbi [[Nathan Adler]], and following in the latter's footsteps, accepted an [[Asceticism in Judaism|ascetic]] way of life and turned to kabbalistic studies. He resided in Frankfurt for a duration of 6 years, during which he married his first wife. About 1790, he returned with his wife to Michelstadt where he maintained a yeshiva for many years (serving as ''[[rosh yeshiva]]'' and instructing around 70 students in [[Tanakh]], Talmud, and the works of the ''[[poskim]]'', as well as secular subjects including [[German language|German]] and [[mathematics]]) and served, at first unofficially, until 1822 as a recognized district rabbi. About 1810, after his wife's death, he lived for some time in [[Mannheim]]. For years, his "[[hasidic]]" behavior and extreme [[Jewish vegetarianism|vegetarianism]] (at age 18 he vowed to abstain from animal products; a promise he kept until his death) created tension between him and the majority of his small community, but his reputation as a Baal Shem spread rapidly and Wormser became known throughout Germany as the Michelstadter Ba'al Shem, or the "Ba'al Shem of Michelstadt." He denied any such [[supernatural]] power but agreed to receive people who sought his advice and guidance, giving them [[natural remedies]] and sometimes [[Amulet#Judaism|amulets]]. (He often said that whatever he does is done naturally and ''[[b'Ezrat HaShem]]''). He became particularly known for his treatment of [[lunatic]]s. Among the Jews of southern Germany many traditions survived regarding his miraculous cures and other feats. It was in Mannheim that he married his second wife. He studied [[German philosophy]] and was particularly attracted by [[Friedrich Wilhelm Joseph Schelling]]. In 1822, he returned to Michelstadt. In 1825, his house and large library were destroyed by fire. Of his talmudic writings, preserved by his descendants, almost nothing was published. A catalogue of his second library is preserved in Ms. Heidenheim 206, in the [[Zentralbibliothek Zürich|Central Library of Zürich]].{{cite encyclopedia|last=Scholem|first=Gershom|author-link=Gershom Scholem|encyclopedia=[[Encyclopaedia Judaica]]|title=WORMSER, SECKEL|url=https://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/judaica/ejud_0002_0021_0_21110.html|access-date=March 8, 2015|year=2008|publisher=[[American–Israeli Cooperative Enterprise]]|publication-date=2013}}
'''''Encyclopaedia Judaica'' bibliography''': *{{abbr|M.|Michael}} Wormser, ''Das Leben und Wirken des zu Michelstadt verstorbenen Rabbiners Zeckel Loeb Wormser'' (1853); *{{abbr|H.|Herz}} Ehrmann (Judaeus), ''[https://www.amazon.com/Baalschem-Von-Michelstadt-Judaeus/dp/B00M4H59US/ref=sr_1_fkmr0_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1425956332&sr=1-1-fkmr0&keywords=Der+Baalschem+von+Michelstadt%3A+kulturgeschichtliche+Erzaehlung Der Baalschem von Michelstadt: kulturgeschichtliche Erzaehlung]'' (1922; contains also memories about him from a contemporary manuscript). == References == {{Reflist}} == Further reading == *{{cite book|last=Ehrmann|first=Herz Naftali|year=2006|title=The Baal Shem of Michelstadt|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=buf4uuKr5nAC&printsec=frontcover&dq=&hl=en&sa=X&ei=QmX-VKOwA4KmgwTrhYOoDA&ved=0CB8Q6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false|publisher=[[Feldheim Publishers]]|isbn=1-58330-892-X}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wormser, Sekl Loeb}} [[Category:1768 births]] [[Category:1846 deaths]] [[Category:German rabbis]] [[Category:Kabbalists]] [[Category:Baal Shem]] [[Category:People from Michelstadt]] [[Category:Rosh yeshivas]] [[Category:Talmudists]] {{Germany-rabbi-stub}}

revision.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/204.14.236.211|204.14.236.211]] ([[User talk:204.14.236.211|talk]]) to last revision by Acroterion. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
[[File:Sommelier F.I.S.A.R..jpg|thumb|A sommelier with a [[tastevin]] around his neck]] A '''sommelier''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|s|ɒ|m|əl|j|eɪ}} or {{IPAc-en|s|ʌ|m|əl|ˈ|j|eɪ}}; {{IPA-fr|sɔməlje}}), or '''wine steward''', is a trained and knowledgeable [[wine]] professional, normally working in fine [[restaurant]]s, who specializes in all aspects of wine service as well as [[wine and food pairing]]. The role in [[haute cuisine|fine dining]] today is much more specialized and informed than that of a wine waiter. Sommeliers Australia states that the role is strategically on par with that of the ''[[chef de cuisine]]''.<ref>[http://www.sommeliers.com.au/about.aspx?pageID=390 What is a sommelier?] Sommeliers Australia</ref>
==Description== [[Image:Sommelier Knife2.jpg|thumb|right|The [[sommelier knife]] is an important tool of the sommelier.]] [[Image:Tastevin.jpg|thumb|right|The [[tastevin]] vessel used by sommeliers in the past and still a symbol today]]
A sommelier may be responsible for the development of wine lists, and books<ref name=OCW-sommelier>winepros.com.au. {{Cite web|last= ''The Oxford Companion to Wine''|title= sommelier|url= http://www.winepros.com.au/jsp/cda/reference/oxford_entry.jsp?entry_id=3001|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20120130191826/http://www.winepros.com.au/jsp/cda/reference/oxford_entry.jsp?entry_id=3001|archivedate= 2012-01-30|df= }}</ref> and for the delivery of wine service and training for the other restaurant staff. Working along with the culinary team, they [[Wine and food matching|pair and suggest wines]] that will best complement each particular food menu item. This entails the need for a deep knowledge of how food and wine, beer, spirits and other beverages work in harmony. A professional sommelier also works on the floor of the restaurant and is in direct contact with restaurant [[patron]]s. The sommelier has a responsibility to work within the taste preference and budget parameters of the patron.
In modern times, a sommelier's role may be considered broader than working only with wines, and may encompass all aspects of the restaurant's service, with an enhanced focus on wines, beers, spirits, soft-drinks, cocktails, mineral waters, and tobaccos.
==Etymology== The modern word is [[French language|French]], deriving from [[Middle French]] where it referred to a court official charged with transportation of supplies.<ref name=mwsomm>{{cite web |url= http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/sommelier|title= sommelier|accessdate=2009-02-27 |publisher= The Merriam-Webster Dictionary}}</ref> This use of the term dates to a period when [[pack animal]]s would be used to transport supplies. The Middle French probably finds its origin in [[Old Provençal]] where a ''saumalier'' was a pack animal driver.<ref name=mwsomm/> ''Sauma'' referred to a pack animal or the load of a pack animal. In [[Late Latin]], ''sagma'' referred to a packsaddle.<ref name=mwsomm/>
==Education and certification== [[File:Tecklenburg Natalie Lumpp 01.JPG|thumb|[[:de:Natalie Lumpp|Natalie Lumpp]], noted German sommelier, who came up through the hotel industry.]] Though 'sommelier' is a job title potentially anyone may claim, becoming a professional certified sommelier often requires some combination of experience, training, formal education (a bachelor's degree is not required, but individuals may do a two-year associate degree), classes and examinations.<ref>{{cite web|title=Become a Sommelier – Education and Career Information|url=http://study.com/articles/Become_a_Sommelier_Education_and_Career_Information.html }}</ref> It is possible to become a sommelier by starting at the entry level in the hospitality or wine industry and working up, though many choose to become educated and professionally certified by one (or more) of the many certifying bodies. Various certifications are offered by a wide range of educators. A very basic education in wine may be attained over the course of months at a cost in the hundreds of dollars, but advanced professional certification typically requires years of study, practice and experience costing thousands of dollars. It has been noted that a thorough education in wine is still less expensive than typical [[graduate school]] costs in the US.<ref>[[Bianca Bosker]], ''Cork Dork'', [[Penguin Books]] 2017</ref>
===Union de la Sommellerie Française===
In [[France]], the ''Union des Sommeliers''<ref name="UDSF">[http://www.sommelier-france.org/udsf/historique-de-lunion-de-la-sommellerie-francaise Union De la Sommellerie Française] - Historique (in French)</ref> (UDS) was founded in 1907 to ensure social protection for its members, both sommeliers and cellar masters in [[Paris]] region. The approach and role of the association developed throughout the years as it lost its autonomy by merging with the ''Mutualité Hôtelière'' in 1959.<ref name="UDSF" /><ref>[http://www.champchefs.com/retrospectives/paris-a-century-of-history.html Champchefs] - Paris a century of history</ref> Ten years later, sommeliers regained their independence as the ''Association des Sommeliers de Paris'' (ASP) was founded in 1969.<ref name="UDSF" /> In the same year the ''[[Association de la Sommellerie Internationale]]'' (ASI) was created and federated other organisations in the world,<ref>[http://www.sommellerie-internationale.com/en/about_asi/ Association de la Sommellerie Internationale] - About ASI</ref> and in 1970 the old UDS was renamed in ''Union de la Sommellerie Française'', UDSF, which supervises today the 21 regional associations in France (including ASP).<ref>[http://www.sommeliers-international.com/en/udsf/French-Sommellerie.aspx www.sommmeliers-international.com] - UDSF</ref> The title of ''Mention Complémentaire Sommellerie'' (MCS) and ''Brevet Professionnel de Sommelier'' (BP)<ref>[http://www.sommelier-france.org/metier/formations Union De la Sommellerie Française - Le Metier] (in French)</ref> can be achieved studying for many different approved providers,<ref>[http://www.sommelier-france.org/metier/les-ecoles Union De la Sommellerie Française] - Les Ecoles (in french)</ref> and the final qualification of ''Maître Sommelier''<ref>[http://www.sommelier-france.org/udsf/maitre-sommelier Union De la Sommellerie Française - Maitre Sommelier] (in French)</ref> can be achieved after an accurate career assessment, requiring at least 10 years of professional experience.
===Associazione Italiana Sommelier===
In Italy, the [[Italian Sommelier Association]],<ref>{{cite web|title= Italian Sommelier Association | url=http://www.aisitalia.it/ }} - (in Italian)</ref> 'AIS', founded on July 7, 1965,<ref name="nasa-ais">{{cite web |title= North American Sommelier Association |url= http://www.nasommelier.com/about/ais-affiliation/ |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20131219025934/http://www.nasommelier.com/about/ais-affiliation/ |archivedate= 2013-12-19 |df= }} - WSA / AIS Affiliation</ref> is one of the oldest sommelier associations of the world. It is officially recognised and legally acknowledged by the Italian government.<ref>{{cite web|title= Italian Sommelier Association | url=http://www.aisitalia.it/la-storia-dellais.aspx }} - (in italian)</ref> Italian Sommelier Association is part and founding member of the ''Worldwide Sommelier Association'' (WSA),<ref>{{cite web |title= WorldWide Sommelier Association |url= http://www.worldwidesommelier.com/associazione.php?L=en |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20131219023219/http://www.worldwidesommelier.com/associazione.php?L=en |archivedate= 2013-12-19 |df= }} - The Association</ref> which is officially recognized throughout the world. It is actually the largest sommelier association ever featuring over 33,000 members only in Italy.<ref name="nasa-ais"/> AIS / WSA is famous worldwide<ref name="nasa-ais" /> for its technical tasting approach and methodology, patented [[Wine and food matching|food & wine pairing]] technique, publications, service standards and three-levels course structure which leads to the ''Certified Sommelier'' qualification. A ''Professional Sommelier'' qualification and diploma is issued by AIS, after a candidate's career assessment, for those sommeliers actually working in a [[food and beverage]] establishment.<ref>{{cite web|title= Sense The Wine | url=http://www.sensethewine.com/italian-sommelier-association/ }} - Italian Sommelier Association</ref>
===Wine & Spirit Education Trust===
The [[Wine & Spirit Education Trust]], often referred to as 'WSET', is a [[United Kingdom|British]] organisation which arranges courses and exams in the field of [[wine]] and [[Distilled beverage|spirits]]. It was founded in 1969,<ref>{{cite web|last= Ray |first= Johnathan, ''The Daily Telegraph'' |title= The top wine-tasting courses |url= https://www.telegraph.co.uk/wine/main.jhtml?xml=/wine/2008/08/29/wine-jonathan-ray129.xml|date= August 29, 2008 }}</ref> is headquartered in [[London]],<ref>[http://www.wsetglobal.com/about_us/default.asp WSET] - About Us</ref> and is generally regarded as one of the world's leading providers of wine education.<ref>J. Robinson (ed), ''[[The Oxford Companion to Wine]]'', Third Edition, p. 769, [[Oxford University Press]] 2006, {{ISBN|0-19-860990-6}}</ref> WSET courses and qualifications are offered in compliance to the new UK [[Qualifications and Credit Framework]], from level 1 to level 3; they also offer a level 4 diploma in wine and spirits and WSET Certified Educator qualifications.<ref>[http://www.wsetglobal.com/qualifications/default.asp WSET] - Qualifications</ref> Although WSET does not market itself as a sommelier certification and education body, many sommeliers choose to earn these qualifications. In 2012 WSET launched a level 1 award in wine service, as an introduction to the sommellerie.
===The Court of Master Sommeliers===
The [[Court of Master Sommeliers]] (CMS), established in 1977, is an independent examining body that offers the 'Master Sommelier Diploma', the 'Advanced Sommelier Certificate', the 'Certified Sommelier Certificate', and the 'Introductory Sommelier Certificate'. It was created under the supervision of the [[Worshipful Company of Vintners]], the Institute of [[Masters of Wine]], the British Hotels & Restaurants Association, the [[Wine and Spirit Trade Association]] of Great Britain, and the Wholesale Tobacco Trade Association.<ref name=sommjancis>{{cite web|last= Robinson |first= Jancis, jancisrobinson.com |title= Master Sommeliers - who are they? |date= June 29, 2005 |url= http://www.jancisrobinson.com/articles/winenews050629.html }}</ref> Since the Master Sommelier Diploma was introduced in 1969, a total of 249 people from around the world had become Master Sommeliers by the end of 2017.<ref name=mastersomms>{{cite web | title = Court of Master Sommeliers|url=http://www.courtofmastersommeliers.org/members |accessdate=February 13, 2018}}</ref> The Court also offers intermediate levels of education including the annual "Advanced Sommelier Course", which prepares invited candidates to sit for the Advanced Exam, generally offered 2–3 times per year. Taking the Advanced Course and passing the Advanced Exam are mandatory before sitting for the Masters Exam.
===International Sommelier Guild===
The ''International Sommelier Guild''<ref>{{cite web|title= International Sommelier Guild |url= http://www.internationalsommelier.com}}</ref> (ISG) educates and certifies sommeliers in Canada, China and the United States. It was founded in 1982 and the programme consists of Level 1 Wine Fundamentals, Level 2 Wine Fundamentals and a Sommelier Diploma. They also offer a 'Certified Sommelier Instructor' diploma.<ref>{{cite web |title= International Sommelier Guild - ISG Courses |url= http://www.internationalsommelier.com/courses/home_courses |website= internationalsommelier.com |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20131222205752/https://www.internationalsommelier.com/courses/home_courses |archivedate= 2013-12-22 |df= }}</ref>
===International Wine & Spirits Guild===
The International Wine Guild was founded in 1998 and is approved and regulated by the [[Colorado Department of Higher Education]].<ref> [http://www.internationalwineguild.com/ International Wine Guild]</ref> The independent school offers the Level IV 'Guild Master Wine Educator Diploma', the Level III 'Guild Wine Master Diploma and Certification', the Level II 'Advanced Wine Course and Executive Sommelier Certification' and the Level I 'Introductory Wine Sommelier Certification'. The International Wine & Spirits Guild was established to encourage study to develop technical and professional understanding and increased knowledge of wine throughout all areas of the wine, spirits and food service industry. IWSG also offers professional courses and certifications for Wine Judges, Wine Instructors, and in Fine [[Distilled beverage|Spirits]] and [[Sake]].
===North American Sommelier Association===
The North American Sommelier Association was founded in 2006 and is the official representative in the United States and Canada of the Worldwide Sommelier Association (WSA). Its Certified Sommelier course is divided into three phases but is offered as one entire course and includes extensive class time, lectures, educational visits to wineries, and educational dinners. Unlike other groups, NASA has only two tiers of Sommelier qualification: Silver-Pin and Gold-Pin. The Gold-Pin qualification is obtained through a series of extensive requirements and certifications (Master Wine Taster, Master Of Service...) as well as proof of experience in the industry. Aside from the Sommelier Certification, NASA also provides various smaller proprietary specialization courses , such as 'Italian Wine Specialist', 'American Wine Specialist', 'Spanish Wine Specialist' and various master-classes such as 'Master Of Terroir', 'Master of Sangiovese', 'Master of Service', and 'Master Wine Taster'.{{fact|date=January 2018}}
===National Wine School===
The National Wine School was founded in 2009 in [[Los Angeles]], California.<ref>[http://www.winecertifications.com/ National Wine School] </ref> The school offers [[ANSI]]-compliant professional certification for the wine trade in the United States. They offer five levels of wine certification. To earn a sommelier pin, one must complete level three certification. To earn the advanced sommelier pin, the student must complete the level four certification.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Guide to Wine Certifications in America: Sommelier Programs in the United States|url=http://www.somm.us/certifications/|website=Sommelier Schools and Certifications}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sommelier Certification: National Wine School|url=http://www.somm.us/national-wine-school/|website=Sommelier Schools and Certifications|date=18 May 2016}}</ref>
=== Commission of European Sommeliers === The Commission of European Sommeliers Bulgaria (CES, BG) is Eastern Europe's main wine qualification. It began in 1997 offering European and International students a more cost effective qualification comparable to the quality of other more established wine qualifications. Their entry level qualification, ‘Certified Sommelier’ takes 10 days to complete, inclusive of two exams. The ‘Advanced Sommelier’ course and ‘Master Sommelier’ course both take an additional 8 days. There is one Prof. and Master Sommelier conducting the courses that take place only twice annually in [[Septemvri]], [[Bulgaria]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.commissionofeuropeansommeliers.bg|title=Homepage}}</ref>
==Other types of sommelier== Apart from wine, other specialized beverage service roles include: [[beer sommelier]] (also called a cicerone),<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.merriam-webster.com/words-at-play/cicerone-a-beer-sommelier |title=What to call your local beer expert|accessdate=23 March 2018}}</ref> [[whisky]] sommelier, [[water]] sommelier,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/i-went-to-a-water-tasting-with-a-water-sommelier-and-it-was-not-nearly-as-crazy-as-you-think-2015-6|title=How a day 'water tasting' with a water sommelier cured my skepticism about fancy hydration|publisher=}}</ref> [[milk]] sommelier,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/on-small-business/wp/2017/06/13/will-restaurants-soon-hire-milk-sommeliers/|title=Will restaurants soon hire 'Milk Sommeliers?'|publisher=Washington Post}}</ref> and [[sake]] sommelier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sakesommelierassociation.com|title=Sake Sommelier Association|publisher=}}</ref>
==See also== {{portal|Wine}} * [[Beer sommelier]] * ''[[Confrérie des Chevaliers du Tastevin]]'' * [[Court of Master Sommeliers]] * [[Italian Sommelier Association|Italian Sommelier Association (AIS)]] * [[Maître d']] * [[Master of Wine]] * [[Wine accessory]] * [[Wine and Spirit Education Trust|Wine & Spirit Education Trust (WSET)]] * [[List of wine personalities]]

'''Thomas Hutton-Mills''' (14 November 1894, [[Accra]]<ref name=Doortmont>Michael R. Doortmont, ''The Pen-Pictures of Modern Africans and African Celebrities by Charles Francis Hutchison: A Collective Biography of Elite Society in the Gold Coast Colony'', Brill, 2005, p. 266</ref> – 11 May 1959, [[London]]) was a lawyer, politician and diplomat in the [[Gold Coast (British colony)|Gold Coast]] and subsequently [[Ghana]].
==Biography== Thomas Hutton-Mills was the son of [[Thomas Hutton-Mills Sr.]], a prominent lawyer and politician in the Gold Coast. He was educated at [[King's Lynn]] and [[Cambridge University]]. Called to the Bar from the [[Inner Temple]] in 1921, he practiced law in the Gold Coast. An early member of [[Kwame Nkrumah]]'s [[Convention People's Party]], he was imprisoned with other party leaders in 1950 for his part in the boycotts and strikes of that year.<ref name=Times>"MR. T. HUTTON-MILLS", ''[[The Times]]'', 12 May 1959.</ref>
Elected as a member for [[Accra]] to the [[Legislative Assembly of the Gold Coast|Legislative Assembly]] in the [[Gold Coast legislative election, 1951|1951 elections]], Hutton-Mills became Minister for Commerce Industry and Mines, and then Minister of Health and Labour. In 1954 he was dropped from the Cabinet, and replaced by [[Imoru Egala]].<ref>Daniel Miles McFarland, ''Historical Dictionary of Ghana'', [[Scarecrow Press]], 1995, p. 98.</ref> Becoming a diplomat, Hutton-Mills was a Deputy Commissioner in London for several years before being appointed Ghana's Ambassador to [[Liberia]].<ref name=Times/>
On his death at a London hospital in 1959, he was 63 years old.<ref name=Times/>
He was a distant cousin of the late Ghanaian president [[John Atta Mills]].

revision.text:
{{Infobox serial killer | name = Wang Qiang | image = | caption = | alt = | birthname = Wang Qiang | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date|1975|1|16|df=y}} | birth_place = Budayuan Town, [[Kuandian Manchu Autonomous County]], [[Liaoning]], [[China]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2005|11|17|1975|1|16|df=y}} | death_place = [[China]] | cause = [[Capital Punishment in China]] | conviction = | sentence = [[Capital punishment|Death]] | victims = 45+ | beginyear = 1995 | endyear = 2003 | country = [[China]] | states = | apprehended = 14 july 2003 }} {{Chinese name|[[Wang (surname)|Wang]]}} '''Wang Qiang''' ({{zh|s=王强|t=王強|p=Wáng Qiáng}}) (16 January 1975 - 17 November 2005) was a serial killer from Budayuan Town, [[Kuandian Manchu Autonomous County]], [[Liaoning]], [[China]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.sohu.com/20030719/n224814133.shtml|script-title=zh:辽特大系列杀人、强奸案告破 百日会战显成效|publisher=搜狐网 来源：东北新闻网|date=2003-07-19 |accessdate=2010-07-30 |language=Zh}}</ref> and one of the most notorious [[murderer]]s and [[rapist]]s in Chinese history.
Wang grew up in the small village of [[Kaiyuan, Liaoning|Kaiyuan]], [[Liaoning|Liaoning city]]. His father was [[child abuse|abusive]], [[addiction|addicted]] to drinking and gambling, and denied Wang the chance to enter school.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://shang.cnfamily.com/200506/ca16435.htm|script-title=zh:残杀45人，嗜血魔头没有父母没有家|publisher=家庭期刊集团 原载《家庭》2005年6期 文/肖 宁|date= 1 June 2005|accessdate=30 July 2010 |language=Zh}}</ref>
Wang committed his first [[murder]] on 22 January 1995. He was [[arrest]]ed on 14 July 2003. Official records show he was convicted of 45 murders and 10 [[rape]]s. Some young girls were [[necrophilia|raped post-mortem]].
Wang was sentenced to death for the murders and executed in November 2005.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2005-04-07/15546319039.shtml |title=辽宁连环杀人犯王强的双面人生：杀了人从来不跑 (untranslated) |author= |publisher=Sina.cn |date=7 April 2005 |accessdate=24 August 2014}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
